poem:
### Crying

Dark hitch in the throat  
of the new leaf;  
a shade not yet  
to tastes of sun.  
Mothers, fathers -  
no chart for this  
rain their hearts.  
Hush, now. Cry  
is the proof  
of life's unanswered  
question, a shell  
the sea carries  
to reckless shores.
